revised_title: Development and Structure of the Wing in the Common Fowl
tldr: The author examines the structure and development of the wing in the common fowl, focusing on the carpus and its elements. They find that the two persistent carpals in the bird's wing, the intermedio-radiale and centralo-ulnare, are compound structures containing remnants of other bones. The study also traces the development of the three metacarpal bones and the distal phalanges, providing insights into the wing's structure and evolution.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Ornithology
